alert.note: Alert for Coastal New Hanover; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 4:16PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Thunderstorms will bring gusty winds and heavy rain across the Wilmington metro area... At 415 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Wilmington to Town Creek. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Leland, Bishop, Mayfaire, Hightsville, Cape Fear Community College North Campus, Wrightsboro, Wilmington International Airport, Town Creek, Murrayville, University Of North Carolina At Wilmington, Windemere, Ogden, Landfall, Winnabow, Kings Grant, Bayshore, Seagate, Belville and Navassa. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 near mile marker 416. Interstate 140 US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 36 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to brief, localized flooding. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Coastal New Hanover; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover
